result.execSummary:
The defendant Andy J Arena was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andy J Arena is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andy J Arena was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Possible addt'l credit for 23 days to be determined upon revocation.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-prev provided per DCSO.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Stephanie R Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
